text: Your Monday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to ‘The Daily’A surge in shootings.
Listen to ‘Nice White Parents’Is this a blueprint for real, systemic change?

Despite the recession, polling data suggest that a confluence of factors are raising President Trump’s standing on the economy issue.Mr. Trump’s relative strength on the economy is among the crucial dynamics in battleground states that are expected to decide the election.
With a program heavy on all things President Trump, the convention offers a test of whether he can appeal beyond his base.
But President Trump’s convention speech is only the latest example of how he has further blurred the lines between the government and his campaign.
Of all the president’s children, he has the strongest connection to the politics and online disinformation ecosystem that put his father in the White House.
TV networks face a challenge in covering the convention while keeping viewers informed of the facts.
People gather Monday near the scene where Jacob Blake was shot by police officers in Kenosha, Wis. Carlos Ortiz for The New York Times

DeJoy Defends Postal Changes as Trump Continues to Attack Voting by MailFacing tough questioning from a House panel, the postmaster general denounced suggestions that he was working to help President Trump politically.

Trump Keeps Promoting a Prescription Drug Order That No One Has SeenThe president’s campaign has made his efforts to lower drug prices a centerpiece of his re-election pitch, but the executive order remains unseen.

Florida Judge Strikes Down Order Requiring Schools to Physically ReopenThe judge said the requirement was unconstitutional because it “arbitrarily disregards safety,” in a win for teachers’ unions.Researchers in Hong Kong reported the first confirmed case of reinfection with the coronavirus. Here’s the latest.

College Reopening: The Outlook for In-Person ClassesThe latest edition of our Coronavirus Schools Briefing looks at how U.S. colleges are starting the semester and the challenges for students with special needs.

Why Are U.S. Virus Cases Falling? Effective Restrictions, Experts SayInfection rates remain among the world’s highest, but numbers are down. All states driving the decrease have at least some local mask mandates.
Smoke from nearby wildfires shrouded Oakland, Calif., on Monday. Jim Wilson/The New York Times
LIVECalifornia is now fighting 625 active fires. Here’s the latest.
Corissa Barro, who uses a wheelchair, said that Zoom has enabled her to become a regular at a local club’s weekly Goth night.
Peter WehnerConservatives Have Only One Choice in 2020After what we have seen during Trump’s first term, any true conservative should be appalled by the prospect of a second.
Gail Collins and Bret StephensTrump’s Reality TV Show Would Like You to Forget About Reality for a WhileUntil Nov. 4, to be precise.

Any aspirational appeals from some speakers seemed doomed to be shadowed by the often ominous tone of the evening.
President Trump’s planned White House speech is a new example of his blurring of the line between government and campaign.
Of all the president’s children, he has the strongest connection to the politics and online disinformation ecosystem that put his father in the White House.

Second Night of Unrest in Wisconsin After Police Shoot Man in the BackThe state’s National Guard was called out in Kenosha as protesters ignored a curfew to protest the shooting of Jacob Blake by a white police officer.

DeJoy Defends Postal Changes as Trump Continues to Attack Voting by MailFacing tough questioning from a House panel, the postmaster general denounced suggestions that he was working to help President Trump politically.

Trump Keeps Promoting a Prescription Drug Order That No One Has SeenThe president’s campaign has made his efforts to lower drug prices a centerpiece of his re-election pitch, but the executive order remains unseen.
